t: Matthew 13
The*p same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.
And*p great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
And*p he spake many things unto them in parables, saying, Behold,*r a*r sower*r went*r forth*r to*r sow;*r
And*rp when*r he*r sowed,*r some*r seeds*r fell*r by*r the*r way*r side,*r and*r the*r fowls*r came*r and*r devoured*r them*r up:*r
Some*rp fell*r upon*r stony*r places,*r where*r they*r had*r not*r much*r earth:*r and*r forthwith*r they*r sprung*r up,*r because*r they*r had*r no*r deepness*r of*r earth:*r
And*rp when*r the*r sun*r was*r up,*r they*r were*r scorched;*r and*r because*r they*r had*r no*r root,*r they*r withered*r away.*r
And*rp some*r fell*r among*r thorns;*r and*r the*r thorns*r sprung*r up,*r and*r choked*r them:*r
But*rp other*r fell*r into*r good*r ground,*r and*r brought*r forth*r fruit,*r some*r an*r hundredfold,*r some*r sixtyfold,*r some*r thirtyfold.*r
Who*rp hath*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
And*p the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?
He*p answered and said unto them, Because*r it*r is*r given*r unto*r you*r to*r know*r the*r mysteries*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven,*r but*r to*r them*r it*r is*r not*r given.*r

For*rp whosoever*r hath,*r to*r him*r shall*r be*r given,*r and*r he*r shall*r have*r more*r abundance:*r but*r whosoever*r hath*r not,*r from*r him*r shall*r be*r taken*r away*r even*r that*r he*r hath.*r
Therefore*rp speak*r I*r to*r them*r in*r parables:*r because*r they*r seeing*r see*r not;*r and*r hearing*r they*r hear*r not,*r neither*r do*r they*r understand.*r

And*rp in*r them*r is*r fulfilled*r the*r prophecy*r of*r Esaias,*r which*r saith,*r By*r hearing*r ye*r shall*r hear,*r and*r shall*r not*r understand;*r and*r seeing*r ye*r shall*r see,*r and*r shall*r not*r perceive:*r

For*rp this*r people's*r heart*r is*r waxed*r gross,*r and*r their*r ears*r are*r dull*r of*r hearing,*r and*r their*r eyes*r they*r have*r closed;*r lest*r at*r any*r time*r they*r should*r see*r with*r their*r eyes,*r and*r hear*r with*r their*r ears,*r and*r should*r understand*r with*r their*r heart,*r and*r should*r be*r converted,*r and*r I*r should*r heal*r them.*r
But*rp blessed*r are*r your*r eyes,*r for*r they*r see:*r and*r your*r ears,*r for*r they*r hear.*r

For*rp verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r many*r prophets*r and*r righteous*r men*r have*r desired*r to*r see*r those*r things*r which*r ye*r see,*r and*r have*r not*r seen*r them;*r and*r to*r hear*r those*r things*r which*r ye*r hear,*r and*r have*r not*r heard*r them.*r
Hear*rp ye*r therefore*r the*r parable*r of*r the*r sower.*r

When*rp any*r one*r heareth*r the*r word*r of*r the*r kingdom,*r and*r understandeth*r it*r not,*r then*r cometh*r the*r wicked*r one,*r and*r catcheth*r away*r that*r which*r was*r sown*r in*r his*r heart.*r This*r is*r he*r which*r received*r seed*r by*r the*r way*r side.*r
But*rp he*r that*r received*r the*r seed*r into*r stony*r places,*r the*r same*r is*r he*r that*r heareth*r the*r word,*r and*r anon*r with*r joy*r receiveth*r it;*r

Yet*rp hath*r he*r not*r root*r in*r himself,*r but*r dureth*r for*r a*r while:*r for*r when*r tribulation*r or*r persecution*r ariseth*r because*r of*r the*r word,*r by*r and*r by*r he*r is*r offended.*r

He*rp also*r that*r received*r seed*r among*r the*r thorns*r is*r he*r that*r heareth*r the*r word;*r and*r the*r care*r of*r this*r world,*r and*r the*r deceitfulness*r of*r riches,*r choke*r the*r word,*r and*r he*r becometh*r unfruitful.*r

But*rp he*r that*r received*r seed*r into*r the*r good*r ground*r is*r he*r that*r heareth*r the*r word,*r and*r understandeth*r it;*r which*r also*r beareth*r fruit,*r and*r bringeth*r forth,*r some*r an*r hundredfold,*r some*r sixty,*r some*r thirty.*r
Another*p parable put he forth unto them, saying, The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r likened*r unto*r a*r man*r which*r sowed*r good*r seed*r in*r his*r field:*r
But*rp while*r men*r slept,*r his*r enemy*r came*r and*r sowed*r tares*r among*r the*r wheat,*r and*r went*r his*r way.*r
But*rp when*r the*r blade*r was*r sprung*r up,*r and*r brought*r forth*r fruit,*r then*r appeared*r the*r tares*r also.*r
So*rp the*r servants*r of*r the*r householder*r came*r and*r said*r unto*r him,*r Sir,*r didst*r not*r thou*r sow*r good*r seed*r in*r thy*r field?*r from*r whence*r then*r hath*r it*r tares?*r
He*rp said*r unto*r them,*r An*r enemy*r hath*r done*r this.*r The*r servants*r said*r unto*r him,*r Wilt*r thou*r then*r that*r we*r go*r and*r gather*r them*r up?*r
But*rp he*r said,*r Nay;*r lest*r while*r ye*r gather*r up*r the*r tares,*r ye*r root*r up*r also*r the*r wheat*r with*r them.*r

Let*rp both*r grow*r together*r until*r the*r harvest:*r and*r in*r the*r time*r of*r harvest*r I*r will*r say*r to*r the*r reapers,*r Gather*r ye*r together*r first*r the*r tares,*r and*r bind*r them*r in*r bundles*r to*r burn*r them:*r but*r gather*r the*r wheat*r into*r my*r barn.*r
Another*p parable put he forth unto them, saying, The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r to*r a*r grain*r of*r mustard*r seed,*r which*r a*r man*r took,*r and*r sowed*r in*r his*r field:*r

Which*rp indeed*r is*r the*r least*r of*r all*r seeds:*r but*r when*r it*r is*r grown,*r it*r is*r the*r greatest*r among*r herbs,*r and*r becometh*r a*r tree,*r so*r that*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r come*r and*r lodge*r in*r the*r branches*r thereof.*r

Another*p parable spake he unto them; The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r unto*r leaven,*r which*r a*r woman*r took,*r and*r hid*r in*r three*r measures*r of*r meal,*r till*r the*r whole*r was*r leavened.*r
All*p these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:
That*p it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.
Then*p Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.
He*p answered and said unto them, He*r that*r soweth*r the*r good*r seed*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r man;*r
The*rp field*r is*r the*r world;*r the*r good*r seed*r are*r the*r children*r of*r the*r kingdom;*r but*r the*r tares*r are*r the*r children*r of*r the*r wicked*r one;*r
The*rp enemy*r that*r sowed*r them*r is*r the*r devil;*r the*r harvest*r is*r the*r end*r of*r the*r world;*r and*r the*r reapers*r are*r the*r angels.*r
As*rp therefore*r the*r tares*r are*r gathered*r and*r burned*r in*r the*r fire;*r so*r shall*r it*r be*r in*r the*r end*r of*r this*r world.*r
The*rp Son*r of*r man*r shall*r send*r forth*r his*r angels,*r and*r they*r shall*r gather*r out*r of*r his*r kingdom*r all*r things*r that*r offend,*r and*r them*r which*r do*r iniquity;*r
And*rp shall*r cast*r them*r into*r a*r furnace*r of*r fire:*r there*r shall*r be*r wailing*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.*r
Then*rp shall*r the*r righteous*r shine*r forth*r as*r the*r sun*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r their*r Father.*r Who*r hath*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r

Again,*rp the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r unto*r treasure*r hid*r in*r a*r field;*r the*r which*r when*r a*r man*r hath*r found,*r he*r hideth,*r and*r for*r joy*r thereof*r goeth*r and*r selleth*r all*r that*r he*r hath,*r and*r buyeth*r that*r field.*r
Again,*rp the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r unto*r a*r merchant*r man,*r seeking*r goodly*r pearls:*r
Who,*rp when*r he*r had*r found*r one*r pearl*r of*r great*r price,*r went*r and*r sold*r all*r that*r he*r had,*r and*r bought*r it.*r
Again,*rp the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r unto*r a*r net,*r that*r was*r cast*r into*r the*r sea,*r and*r gathered*r of*r every*r kind:*r
Which,*rp when*r it*r was*r full,*r they*r drew*r to*r shore,*r and*r sat*r down,*r and*r gathered*r the*r good*r into*r vessels,*r but*r cast*r the*r bad*r away.*r
So*rp shall*r it*r be*r at*r the*r end*r of*r the*r world:*r the*r angels*r shall*r come*r forth,*r and*r sever*r the*r wicked*r from*r among*r the*r just,*r
And*rp shall*r cast*r them*r into*r the*r furnace*r of*r fire:*r there*r shall*r be*r wailing*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.*r
Jesus*p saith unto them, Have*r ye*r understood*r all*r these*r things?*r They say unto him, Yea, Lord.

Then*p said he unto them, Therefore*r every*r scribe*r which*r is*r instructed*r unto*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r unto*r a*r man*r that*r is*r an*r householder,*r which*r bringeth*r forth*r out*r of*r his*r treasure*r things*r new*r and*r old.*r
And*p it came to pass, that when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.
And*p when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this man this wisdom, and these mighty works?
Is*p not this the carpenter's son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?
And*p his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath this man all these things?
And*p they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, A*r prophet*r is*r not*r without*r honour,*r save*r in*r his*r own*r country,*r and*r in*r his*r own*r house.*r
And*p he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
